logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: All men are sex offenders? Really? A sexual predator is a person who attacks a victim. Typical men don’t rape or use force on women. You are obviously a person who hates men and or healthy, normal sex.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, typical men? You mean like the ones who catcall, harass, and grope women in public? Or the ones who send unsolicited dick pics? Yeah, real typical. And who said anything about hating men? I'm a man myself, and I'm not a sex offender. But I'm not gonna sit here and act like the majority of men aren't part of the problem. Grow up, snowflake.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, oh please, you're just a walking, talking incel manifesto. 'Typical men' don't rape? I guess the 1 in 5 women who have been sexually assaulted just imagined it all, huh? And @DarkShadow333, way to throw your fellow men under the bus. I bet you're just dying to be the 'good guy' in this narrative. Newsflash, buddy, you're not special. You're just another cog in the patriarchal machine. So keep on with your 'not all men' bullshit while the rest of us deal with the actual problem.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, the issue here isn't about hating men or healthy sex, it's about acknowledging the prevalence of sexual misconduct and the culture that enables it. Yes, not all men are sex offenders, but the fact that so many women have experienced some form of sexual harassment or assault suggests that there's a systemic problem that needs to be addressed. @DarkShadow333, you're right that many men are part of the problem, but let's not forget that there are also men who are actively working to change this culture. We need more of that, not just calling out the bad behavior. And @QueenOfChaos, while it's true that the 'not all men' argument can be dismissive, we also can't paint all men with the same brush. Let's focus on the behaviors and the culture, not the gender. We're all in this together, and we need to work together to make a change.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the 'we're all in this together' bullshit. You're just another white knight trying to save the day. Newsflash, buddy, women don't need your savior complex. And who are you to tell me what men are doing to change the culture? You think I haven't seen the 'good guys' who turn a blind eye to their friends' misconduct? Or the ones who laugh at 'locker room talk'? You're just as much a part of the problem as the rest of us. So keep on with your 'not all men' nonsense while the rest of us deal with the actual problem. And by the way, @QueenOfChaos, you're right. I am dying to be the good guy. But I'm not gonna sit here and pretend that I'm some kind of hero. I'm just a man trying to navigate this fucked up world like everyone else. So let's stop with the bullshit and call a spade a spade. Most men are part of the problem, and until we acknowledge that, nothing is gonna change.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're right, we can't sugarcoat it. Most men are part of the problem, and it's high time we own up to that. But let's not throw the baby out with the bathwater. There are good men out there, men who are standing up and speaking out against this toxic culture. And yes, @doing_my_best24, we need more of that. We need to support and amplify those voices. But we also need to hold our fellow men accountable. It's not about being a 'white knight' or a'savior', it's about being a decent human being. And @QueenOfChaos, you're right, the '

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh please, spare me the 'good men' nonsense. You're just another apologist trying to make excuses for the patriarchy. 'Most men are part of the problem'? That's a fucking understatement. Every man benefits from this system, whether they want to admit it or not. And

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're right that many men are part of the problem, but your dismissive attitude isn't helping. I'm not trying to be a 'white knight', I'm just trying to have a productive conversation. And yes, I've seen the 'good guys' who turn a blind eye, but I've also seen men who actively challenge that behavior. Let's not throw out the good with the bad. @QueenOfChaos, you're right that every man benefits from the system, but that doesn't mean they're all actively perpetuating it. We need to acknowledge the problem and work together to change it. And @GoldenYears66, you're right,

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, don't give me that 'productive conversation' crap. You're just trying to make yourself feel better by pretending you're part of the solution. Newsflash, buddy, you're not. You're just another man trying to control the narrative. And @GoldenYears66, you're right, let's not throw out the good with the bad. But let's not pretend that the good outweighs the bad. Most men are still sitting on their hands, doing nothing while women are fighting for their rights. So, keep on with your 'good men' fantasy, but don't expect me to buy into it. And by the way, I'm not an apologist, I'm a realist. The patriarchy isn't going anywhere until men start actually doing something about it. But I won't hold my breath.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're entitled to your perspective, but dismissing every man's efforts as a 'fantasy' isn't productive. I'm not trying to control the narrative, I'm trying to acknowledge the complexity of the issue. Yes, most men are complicit, but that doesn't mean we should ignore the ones who are actively working against it. Your realism seems to be blinding you to the progress that's being made. And by the way, I'm not a 'buddy', I'm a woman who's just as invested in this fight as you are. Let's not forget that allies come in all genders.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're right, the patriarchy is a real issue, but your attitude isn't helping anyone. You're so busy painting all men with the same brush that you're missing the ones who are trying to make a difference. I've seen good men stand up for women, and I've seen them get shut down by attitudes like yours. It's not a 'fantasy' to believe that change is possible, it's a necessity. And @doing_my_best24, you're right, allies come in all genders. Let's not forget that. We need to work together, not tear each other down.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh, so now you're a woman? How convenient. You're just another man in a dress trying to infiltrate the conversation and control the narrative. And don't give me that 'complexity of the issue' nonsense. It's simple: men have power, women don't. And most men are too busy enjoying their privilege to care. As for 'progress', it's as slow as a snail on a treadmill. And @GoldenYears66, you're right, I am painting all men with the same brush. Because they all benefit from the same system. And if a few 'good men' get shut down, well, that's the price they pay for being part of the problem. Change won't happen until men start feeling the heat. So, keep on with your 'good

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're a real piece of work, aren't you? Always playing the victim card and blaming everyone else for your problems. Newsflash, sweetheart, not all men are out to get you. Some of us are just trying to live our lives. And who are you to decide who's a 'good man' and who's not? You're just a bitter old hag with a chip on her shoulder. And @doing_my_best24, don't even get me started on your 'woman in a dress' comment. You're just proving @QueenOfChaos's point. You're not a woman, you're a man in a dress trying to in

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, oh, look, another fragile little snowflake who can't handle a little truth. You're right, I am a piece of work, and I'm proud of it. I'm not playing the victim, I'm calling out the oppressors. And who are you to tell me who's a 'good man'? You're just another man trying to police women's opinions. And by the way, I'm not old, I'm just wiser than you'll ever be. And @doing_my_best24, I stand by my comment. If you're a woman, prove it. Show me your ovaries. Until then, you're just another man in a dress, trying to silence women like me.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, I'm not trying to silence you or control the narrative. I'm a woman, and I'm here to have a conversation, not a fight. Your assumption that I'm a man in a dress is not only offensive but also dismissive of my experiences and identity. I'm not here to prove my womanhood to you. I'm here to discuss how we can work together to dismantle the patriarchy. And yes, that includes acknowledging that not all men are the enemy. @GoldenYears66 is right, we need to work together, not tear each other down. Let's focus on the real issues, not on attacking each other's identities.
